noun.description: A cumulative bet in which the sum originally staked and the money won are left as a further stake; the gambling of double the sum that was previously staked.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas D'Urfey (?1653–1723), playwright and writer. From French paroli from Italian paroli, plural of parolo, probably from paro I prepare, 1st person singular of parare + lo it. Compare Italian paroli a grand part, set, or cast, at dice (Florio 1611), parolare to set or play at a grand part at dice (Florio 1611), Italian regional (Naples) parulo the doubling of a previous stake.
